adviseScripts.text: Counselor, between me, Quency, and Sin...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: who do you think is the nicest?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You.
I think you're all pretty much the same.
Thanks!
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Those other two are far too dangerous.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I knew that I was the nicest.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: The same? But we're all so different.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Are you sure you thought it over properly before answering?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Guilty about what it means to be nice.
Nobody ever listens to me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: No matter how much I protest my innocence, they keep insisting that I'm a criminal.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: How can I get people to hear me out?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Talk louder.
Speak with more conviction.
But I already feel like I'm shouting at the top of my lungs.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: How can I talk any louder than I already am?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Are you even listening to me, Counselor?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: More conviction?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You mean like being more forceful?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I didn't say anything about using force...
Oh... I like it...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You know just how I feel, Counselor.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I can use force to get people to listen to me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I practice speaking with Guilty.
Counselor, can you hold my hand?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I take Guilty's hand in mine.
Your hand feels so nice... just as I thought it would.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Guilty clenches onto my hand more tightly.
Grip even tighter.
Try to remove her hand.
It feels even nicer when you hold my hand tightly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Whenever we hold hands, I want you to hold it like this.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Why are you taking your hand away?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: That only makes me want to hold it more tightly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Guilty loosens her grip.
But I suppose I shouldn't do that... at least not yet.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Guilty while holding hands.
Sin said that lying is a skill in itself.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: But I don't like lying.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Do you ever lie, Counselor?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Never.
Sometimes, and I'm pretty good at it.
... Really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Why does it feel like you're lying to me right now then...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'm not, honestly.
... If you say so.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Why would you say that right after I mentioned how much I dislike lying?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: It's precise because you detest lying that I had to tell the truth.
I suppose you have a point...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You really are an honest person, Counselor.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I really like that about you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I have a bittersweet consultation with Guilty.
Counselor, didn't you say I was rehabilitated?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: If that's true, why am I still in these restraints?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: They're so annoying...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Remove her restraints for a moment.
Ignore her pleas.
*Beep*
After pressing the release button, the restraints on Guilty's hand are unlocked.
Only my hands? I guess it's better than nothing...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I thought you would release the restraints, but I guess not.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: That's too bad...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I comfort the disappointed Guilty.
Counselor, why are you still having consultations with me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Didn't you say I was already rehabilitated?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'm your Counselor. It's my duty to continue these consultations.
I came because I wanted to spend time with you, that's all.
Is...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: is that the only reason?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: So, if you weren't my Counselor, you wouldn't come to see me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: That's so sad...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Really? You came here to see me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: That's so nice... I really look forward to seeing you as well, Counselor.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Guilty and I have an emotional consultation.
Someone once told me that
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Nikkes also need hobbies.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I wonder, what kind of hobby should I pursue?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Going for a walk while holding hands?
Exercising to gain better control over your strength?
But whose hand would I be holding?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Could it... be yours, Counselor?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I nod my head.
That...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: would be wonderful.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Exercising as a hobby?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Counselor, actually...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I don't like the sound of that...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I brainstorm other possible hobbies Guilty could take up.
Whenever I'm with you Counselor, my mood just lifts.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: When are you the happiest, Counselor?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: When I'm alone.
When I'm with you.
Alone?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Does that mean whenever you're with me, you feel bad?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Not at all.
Okay... I thought for a moment my feelings weren't reciprocated.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: All this is making me confused.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You better stop pulling my leg, or I'm going to squeeze you as hard as I can.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Counselor, you too...?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'm glad... I would have felt bad if I was the only one who felt the way I do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: If you had said you don't feel the same way, I don't know what I would have done to you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Either way, I'm glad that's not the case.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I spend a somewhat hair-raising session with Guilty.
Counselor, what do you do when you're feeling overwhelmed?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: How do you get rid of stress?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I sleep.
I exercise.
Does sleeping help relieve stress for you?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: That doesn't work for me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You're certainly a unique person, Counselor.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Exercise?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Right, physical activity always helps get rid of stress.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: If only I could be free of these restraints, then I could move around freely.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Guilty about relieving stress.
I haven't been getting any good sleep lately.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: What should I do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: How about counting sheep?
Want me to hold your hand while you sleep?
Counting sheep?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: What good would that do me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'd much rather you hold my hand...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: That sounds nice...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Then I'd be nice and warm, and I could fall asleep more easily.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Do you think you could do that for me now?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I hold Guilty's hand so she could get some sleep.
Sin always makes fun of me because I'm slow at texting.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I always use voice-to-text, so I can't help that it's slow sometimes...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You should try and learn to text faster.
Don't worry about Sin. She's in the wrong.
But how? I can't send them any faster than I already am.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Voice-to-text always moves at a snail's pace.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You could at least have a little sympathy, Counselor.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: That's what I was saying!
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Sin wouldn't say that if she couldn't use her arms to text.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: She's so mean...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I help Guilty practice how to send texts faster.
Counselor, what do you think is worse?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Hurting someone physically, or hurting their feelings?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Hurting someone physically.
Hurting someone's feelings.
But why? The body heals quickly enough after being injured.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I think hurting someone's feelings is way worse.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I agree.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: People who hurt your feelings are the worst.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: So many people out there will betray your trust.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Whenever I see people like that,
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I just wanna grab them and squeeze...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Guilty about the importance of feelings.
About Sin and Quency,
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: they are way more dangerous than me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Why am I under more heavy restraints than they are?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Because being tied up is a look that really suits you.
Because the crimes you committed were more serious.
So the more restraints I have... the more attractive I am?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I don't understand what you're saying.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I wish you'd take this a little more seriously and quit joking around.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: So that means they think I'm more of a threat, right?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Does that mean you think I'm more of a threat?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I nod my head.
Hmm... not sure if any of this makes me feel any better, but okay...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I listen to Guilty complain more about being tied up.
When I first entered the rehabilitation center, all the other Nikkes came over and were sizing me up.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: What do you think I did when that happened?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You ignored them.
You punched them out.
You really do understand me... good.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: That's right. I ignored them... at first.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Why would I do that?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You really must think I'm some kind of depraved criminal.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I just ignored them, since it was our first time meeting and all.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Okay, but what did you do later on?
Afterwards, I told them that if they were so interested, they should come in for a closer look.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Then I gave a biiiiig ol' squeeze.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: To every last one of them.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: ... I better tell the rest of the Nikkes at the Outpost not to stare at Guilty.
Do you like hugging other people,
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: or do you prefer being hugged?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I like giving hugs.
I like being hugged.
I see...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: That makes two of us then.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: So that's why you shied away from my hugs.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: It made me sad at the time, but at least now I understand why you did it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: You prefer being hugged?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Then why didn't you let me hug you?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I feel so sad now...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I comfort the saddened Guilty.
Counselor...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: My hands...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Are you asking me to untie your hands?
Are you asking me to hold your hand?
That's right! How did you know?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I was hoping you'd pick up on how uncomfortable my hands felt.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'm glad that you noticed.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Um, that's nice too I suppose, but...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: my hands feel really uncomfortable right now. Can't you untie them?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Just for a moment?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I untie Guilty's hands.
Counselor,
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: can you pass me the water bottle that's over there?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Pour some water into a glass and hand it over.
Put a straw in the water bottle.
Are you being mean on purpose? How am I supposed to drink this with my hands tied?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Do you enjoy seeing me suffer?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Could you please put in a straw?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: No one ever put in a straw for me without me having to ask them to...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'm touched...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I help Guilty drink the water comfortably.
Guilty is staring intently at a bottle of hand lotion on the table.
Counselor...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Is this some kind of cruel joke?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Quency said my hands are restrained, so they must be dried and cracked.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: So she left a bottle of hand lotion on the table to torment me with.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Relax. I'll put it on for you.
Maybe?
I guess as long as you help me put it on...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I won't be too angry.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Honestly, I didn't even realize how dry my hands were until I saw the lotion. But now that I see it, it's all I can think about.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: It's... frustrating.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: There's no way I can put it on myself...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'll put it on for you.
I apply some hand lotion on Guilty's hands.
Can I tie you up? I can use a restraint strap like mine.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Just once, pretty please?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: No.
Maybe next time... if we have a chance.
Jeez, you didn't have to be so blunt...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Why are you so mean? Especially when I'm tied up like this...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I can't even do the same to you. It's not fair.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: It's okay. Even if you say no now,
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'll try it one day.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Remember, you promised!
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: No takebacks.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Guilty and I talk about restraint methods.
Sin brought me a mint chocolate soda.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: She said the color suited me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Apparently it's all the rage in the Ark at the moment.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Is there any truth to that?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Yeah, it's delicious.
No. Whatever you do, don't drink it.
Okay, I was curious.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'll try it then...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: It's delicious!
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Don't drink it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Oh, so I should stay away from it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: I'm still curious,
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: so I'm going to try it anyway.
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Guilty begins to drink the mint chocolate soda from a straw.
*Slurp*
It's sweet... refreshing... bitter... and tangy...
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Very interesting flavor. I... think I like it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Guilty

adviseScripts.text: Guilty proceeds to finish the rest of the soda. It seems she enjoys it.
